RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the loop: Highway 59 to Farm-to-Market Road 2050 to U.S. 359

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 59: road where vehicles were inspected and headed towards Corpus, Houston, or Freer, Texas, intersecting with Farm-to-Market Road 2050 to the west of Freer immigration checkpoint, location of a traffic stop, has checkpoints that smugglers try to avoid
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: rural road used by ranchers, oil field workers, and others for daily commute, where Agent Jorge Luis Trevino followed suspicious vehicles, connection between U.S. 359 and Highway 59, a road where the white sedan was going on and off, has intersections with Mills Bennett Road, San Pablo Road, and Santo Nino Road
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 359: road intersecting with Farm-to-Market Road 2050 to the east of the Hebbronville checkpoint, route the truck was traveling on, has checkpoints that smugglers try to avoid
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16: route where picked-up aliens are taken after walking from Farm-to-Market Road 2050, leading to Houston or San Antonio, provides vehicle access via San Pablo Road and Santo Nino Road
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 59 to Farm-to-Market Road 2050 t: indirect route taken by defendants to avoid Hebbronville checkpoint on U.S. 359, also known as 'the loop', convenient route for smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2895: an alternative farm-to-market road, more direct route to Bruni from outside Laredo, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Pablo Road: location of the Moglia ranch house and the Stag trailer, south of the wind farm on FM 2050, extends to Highway 16 providing vehicle access
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Santo Nino Road: also known as Dinn Ranch, extends to the east from Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and provides vehicle access to Highway 16
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ranch Road 2523: ranch road used by smugglers to avoid checkpoints on Highway 277
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 277: highway with a checkpoint that smugglers try to avoid
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 377: highway used by smugglers to avoid checkpoints
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 85: a common smuggling route that avoids immigration checkpoints, located near the United States-Mexico border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 385: a known drug smuggling route in an area known for drug smuggling, specifically in the Big Bend area
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate highway: location where vehicles were heading on a seldom-used remote road to avoid detection
